ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: But as for him who is stingy and self-satisfied,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: But he who does not give and is unconcerned,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: As for him who was a miser and behaved with aversion (to Allah),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: But for those who are niggardly, horde their wealth,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And for him who hoarded wealth and remained carefree,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: But he who is greedy and thinks himself self-sufficient,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And as for him who is niggardly and considers himself free from need (of Allah),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: But as for him who is a miser, and self-sufficient,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: But as for him who hoardeth and deemeth himself independent,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: But as for one who is miserly and unheeding,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And as for him who stinteth and is heedless,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: But as for him, who is stingy and self-complacent,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: But he who is a greedy miser and thinks himself self-sufficient,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: But he who is greedy miser and thinks himself self-sufficient.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: but for him that is a miser, and sufficed,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: But as for him who is stingy and complacent.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: But as for he who withholds and considers himself free of need
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [92:8] But as for him who is niggardly, with what is due to God, and deems himself self-sufficient, without need for His reward,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: 759 (But as for him who hoardeth) his wealth and is too stingy to give for the sake of Allah, in reference here to al-Walid Ibn al-Mughirah and it is said: Abu Sufyan Ibn Harb who was not a believer at that time (and deemeth himself independent) of Allah,
